isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - WEST COAST MAGNUM MIRRORS AND AERO MIRRORS - WEST COAST MAGNUM SERVICE PROCEDURES - Mirror Head Installation To "C" Loop

step1.para: Position the mirror so the wire harness pigtail hangs down to mate with the "C" loop wire harness. Install a washer on the lower pivot rod, then insert the rod through the lower mounting bracket/diagonal brace. Install the lock washer and nut. Replace the gray plastic thread cap.
Install a washer on the upper pivot rod.

Support the mirror head, position the upper pivot rod into the upper mounting bracket/diagonal brace and install a flat washer and lock nut. Tighten upper and lower locknuts to 84 in-lbs. Replace the plastic cap on the pivot rod end.

Use an appropriate tool to remove the strain relief from the lower plate on the new mirror head. Pull wires out of the new mirror head as far as possible. Wires in replacement mirror head should be stripped for splicing.

Color match the new wires with the existing wires from the "C": loop. Splice each wire using the butt splices provided with the replacement mirror. Wrap all splices with electrical tape or heat shrink tubing.
Push wires into mirror head. Be sure splices are inside mirror head.
Verify that mirror functions (heat, motor, light).
Use an appropriate tool to install strain relief. Check mirror travel, manually or with control switch.
